TopicTitle: GDI Black Orca VTOL - From Command & Conquer Series

Articles.Content:
GDI Black Orca VTOL

From the Command & Conquer series

Here's my take on the Orca from C&C.

http://www.whoshotdk.co.uk/KSP/Ships/SPH/Orca/OrcaMkI.craft

DOWNLOAD

You might need to right-click that link and use 'Save As' or similar.

![orca.jpg](http://www.whoshotdk.co.uk/KSP/Ships/SPH/Orca/orca.jpg)

STATISTICS

Subject to change.

**Tonnage:** 10.10t dry

**Parts:** 92

**Kerbin TWR:** 1.38

CONTROLS

**[6]** Toggle running lights

**[7]** Toggle ground lights

NOTES

Twin Jet engines are restricted to 50% and sheÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s perfectly controllable with that power restriction. I found that going much higher will cause her to nose up and flip, despite the number of reaction wheels IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve squeezed in to the design. Increase that level at your own risk!

Use SAS to keep her under control.

Lots of part clipping; extending/retracting landing gear will cause a quick jump but nothing catastrophic. Advisable to turn on SAS and retract gear before take-off. For landing, extend gear well before ground just in case the jump screws you over.

Has RCS jets for fine translation.

There's a Docking Port Jnr under the tail for connecting up a refueling tanker or whatever.

Have fun!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-29T18:10:11Z" title="03/29/2015 06:10  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 29, 2015</time> by whoshotdk**

Oooh,

very nice!

Did you use kerbpaint?

+rep

Hi Mad Rocket Scientist, thanks for the rep!

No Kerbal Paint, this is completely stock! I got the black colour by creative placement of a copious amount of NCS adapters ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Very nice, creative use of the NCS adapters ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Very nice replica, whoshotdk! And I like how you painted it with nose adapters with a low partcount ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Thank you guys, I really appreciate these nice comments! It gives me reason to make more ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
